H0.text: Releasing warm water into the stream would have the greatest positive impact on the water quality of a stream.

H1.text: Driving cars through the stream would have the greatest positive impact on the water quality of a stream.

H2.text: Reducing use of fertilizers near the stream is the human activity that would have the greatest positive impact on the water quality of a stream.

H3.text: Increasing use of chemicals near the stream is the human activity that would have the greatest positive impact on the water quality of a stream.

A4.text: Nutrient pollution from fertilizers causes eutrophication.

A5.text: Nitrate levels above 10 mg/L (10 ppm) in groundwater can cause 'blue baby syndrome' (acquired methemoglobinemia) in infants and possibly thyroid disease and various types of cancer.
